intro: Pterophylla celebica, commonly known as the Celebes pterophylla, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Pterophylla celebica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
